meanings.definition: The quality of being aggressive or combative.
meanings.sent1: His aggressivities often led to conflicts with others.
meanings.sent2: The team's aggressivities on the field were unmatched.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's aggressivities towards the mailman were comically fierce.
meanings.sent4: Her aggressivities in negotiations were like a lion protecting its territory.
meanings.sent5: The aggressivities of the storm made it impossible to go outside.

meanings.definition: The tendency to initiate hostile or violent behavior.
meanings.sent1: The aggressivities of the bull were evident in the way it charged at the matador.
meanings.sent2: The aggressivities of some individuals can be triggered by certain situations.
meanings.sent3: The aggressivities of the toddler were more amusing than alarming.
meanings.sent4: The aggressivities of the ocean waves crashing against the shore were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The aggressivities of the fire ants made it challenging to enjoy a picnic in the park.

meanings.definition: The state of being inclined to attack or confront.
meanings.sent1: The aggressivities of the warrior were evident in every battle.
meanings.sent2: In nature, aggressivities can be a survival mechanism for some species.
meanings.sent3: The aggressivities of the cat towards the laser pointer provided endless entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The aggressivities of the wind against the trees made them sway violently.
meanings.sent5: The aggressivities of the competitor pushed her to strive for excellence.
